intro: Galium subtrifidum, commonly known as narrowleaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Galium subtrifidum typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
